p: To quantify this unusual asymmetric response, we plot in Fig. 2D the integrated area (shaded area in the right-hand panel of Fig. 2C) between the two reflections normalized to the magnitude of the MR (i.e., the difference between the resistivity values at B// c and B// a). The inset in Fig. 2D shows a blowup of the region between 10 and 40 K. A clear onset in the asymmetry is revealed at a temperature T asym = 24 Â± 1 K, implying that it is intimately connected to the resistivity upturn at T min. Moreover, the growth in the asymmetry near T min resembles that of an order parameter. Below 10 K however, the asymmetry grows much more steeply (see the main panel of Fig. 2D for I// a, and fig. S2 for corresponding data for I// b).
